page.title: 18R.A.F. POLICE - WADDINGTON
page.content: The Corporal gets up around 6.00am, puts the kettle on and has breakfast. He then watches TVAM before shaving. The Corporal leaves his house, just across the road from the camp, at about 7.00am. He enjoys his work because but does not like it when he arrives to find something has happened that he can do nothing about. Much of the day is spent patrolling the camp in his jeep. The policemen are trained to fight and are armed but rarely have to use their guns. They rely on intelligence reports of imminent danger before stepping up protection of the camp. In the case of a war alert the whole area for several miles around the camp may be isolated. Before entering the R.A.F. the Corporal worked at the clothes department at Debenhams. His son also wants to be a policeman.
